alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Gonzales; Lee; Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 06 at 11:00PM CDT until August 07 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Increased Fire Danger Continues Across South Central Texas... .A combination of critically to extremely dry fuels and elevated fire weather conditions continue to support wildfires with high resistance to control, per guidance from the Texas A&M Forest Service. It is also being observed that in this very hot air mass relatively light prevailing winds are routinely gusting to more than double the value of the sustained speeds, reaching between 25 and 30 MPH in the late afternoon and early evening hours. Based on these observed conditions and impacts, a Red Flag Warning will be in effect again Monday afternoon and evening for the eastern Hill Country and much of the I-35 corridor. Additional Red Flag Warnings are likely beyond Monday. Elevated to near critical fire weather conditions are expected for the remainder of South Central Texas. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 11 PM CDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY OVER PORTIONS OF THE COASTAL PRAIRIES OF SOUTH CENTRAL TEXAS... * WINDS...South 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 24 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly and exhibit high resistance to control. Any outdoor activity that could produce flames or sparks is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
